intro: Zaluzianskya karrooica, commonly known as the Karoo daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with a central disk. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Zaluzianskya karrooica is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
